Extreme high temperatures also terminate survival. This factor is modelled through a weekly heat stress temperature threshold (TTHS) and its accumulation rate (THHS). Maize is a thermophilic plant species that can tolerate high temperatures
10, 13, 53 . An extended literature review indicated that extremely high temperatures can cause sterility and reduce yield, with 46 °C being the lethal temperature for maize
5, 57 . Maize can tolerate temperatures below 45 °C, if not, drought stress occurs
13, 54 . Temperatures above 40 °C stop crop development, and no further heat units are accumulated for crop development
57 . Thus, TTHS was adjusted to 40 °C, and the THHS was set to 0.01 week −1.
